channel.title: Simple question (My java's a bit rusty)
channel.description: How would I check to see if an integer entered into a command is in an int[]?

item.title: Simple question (My java's a bit rusty)
item.dc:creator: @n10si_t n10si t
item.description:
@n10si_t wrote:

Davidi2:

You don’t add the [] to the end of the variable name, if you’re referencing an array it knows it’s an array

oh, thanks

Read full topic

item.title: Simple question (My java's a bit rusty)
item.dc:creator: @n10si_t n10si t
item.description:
@n10si_t wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:4, topic:412063”]for(int i : int[]) if(i == commandInteger) return true; return false;[/quote]

I have a package of java files called Davidi2IsSmarterThanMe, rofl

thanks again man

EDIT: I’m getting one weird fucking error:

src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:184: error: '.class' expected
                                for (int i : Config.BUYABLE[]) {
                                                             ^
1 error
Press any key to continue . . .

Read full topic
